page.title: 19Housing and Landscape (cont)
page.content: Many farmhouses and cottages date back to the 17th century. Inside, special features can still be found; slate floors, oak panelling, doors and floorboards in oak as well, and spice cupboards built into the thick stone walls, always next to the fireplace to keep things dry. Outside the walls were rendered with thick rubble stone not dressed, plastered over and limewashed, a very effective way of keeping out draughts. This is a typical lakeland area with forestry, farming, bracken covered fells and small tarns. Hawkshead is a compact village, and Colthouse, Outgate and Hawkshead Hill are three hamlets of equal charm. Tarn Hows is a well known beauty spot set amongst the higher fells with breathtaking views. It was visited by Queen Elizabeth II this year.
